meanings.definition: In the direction in which the wind is blowing.
meanings.sent1: We need to move downwind to avoid the strong gusts.
meanings.sent2: The leaves rustled as they fluttered downwind.
meanings.sent3: The kite flew downwind so fast, it almost beat the birds!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter carried downwind, reaching everyone in the park.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers wafted downwind, filling the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: Moving or situated in the same direction as the wind.
meanings.sent1: The downwind boat sailed smoothly with the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The downwind side of the house felt pleasantly cool.
meanings.sent3: The downwind race car zoomed past its competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His downwind hair blew gently in the wind, framing his face.
meanings.sent5: The downwind trees swayed gracefully in the gentle wind.
